results.title: The Pipette
results.creator_credit: Australian Teaching Films, Craig Baynes and L.M. Simmons
results.brief_description: One of a series of instructional films demonstrating the use of chemical apparatus; correct method of using the pipette; cleaning and preparation; filling; adjustment of liquid level to measuring mark; discharging the pipette; washing and cleaning after use.

results.title: The Pipes of Para
results.brief_description: The life of the German settlers in the Barossa Valley of the Adelaide Hills. Tells of an organist’s return to the Barossa Valley after forty years. He goes to the Valley to play for a wedding and as he recognises landmarks en route he recalls the times when, as a young man, he played in the Valley churches on organs designed and built by Lutherans living there. Features Pym Walker.

results.title: The Pioneers
results.creator_credit: Eltham Films, Patrick Ryan and Tim Burstall
results.brief_description: Frederick McCubbin’s melancholy paintings of the hardships of life in the bush in the early days. The ballad accompaniment written by Tim Burstall, music by Carl Ogden, and sung by Glen Tomasetti and Paul Marks.

results.title: The Pioneer Burro
results.creator_credit: Pat Dowling Pictures, Pat Dowling and Thomas Stanton
results.brief_description: Describes the role of the burro and the prospector during the California gold rush and development of the West. The burro was not only the prospector’s companion but also carried supplies and equipment, found water in the desert and foraged for his own food. Shows methods of finding and recovering gold by means of pan and cradle.

results.title: The Pink panther (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Mirisch Corporation, Blake Edwards Productions, Martin Jurow and Blake Edwards
results.brief_description: Peter Sellers debuts in this film as Inspector Closeau and in doing so, has become a movie legend. Romance, intrigue, exotic locations and an all star cast including Claudia Cardinale, David Niven, Robert Wagner and Cappucine, make this film a sheer delight. The movie takes its name from the rare “Pink Panther” gem owned by Princess Dala. The Phantom, a well-known jewel thief is intent on robbery, and Inspector Closeau, while knocking over vases at every turn, attempts to foil the plot. This film includes a universally acclaimed animated sequence featuring the cartoon Panther.

results.title: The Pink panther
results.creator_credit: Mirisch Corporation, Blake Edwards Productions, Martin Jurow and Blake Edwards
results.brief_description: Peter Sellers debuts in the role that made him a legend and launched a number of sequels. As the bumbling Inspector Clouseau, Seller’s own particular brand of comedy comes to the fore. The film takes its title from the rare “Pink Panther” Diamond owned by Princess Dala (Claudia Cardinale). Debonaire David Niven is intent on stealing the jewel and Clouseau must foil this plot. The film also stars Capucine as Clouseau’s none too faithful wife and Robert Wagner as her lover. Henry Mancini’s theme tune and the cartooned figure of the Pink Panther himself add acclaim to this hilarious film.

results.title: The Pink Floyd and Syd Barrett story
results.creator_credit: Otmoor Productions, BBC-TV and John Edington
results.brief_description: Moving documentary about 1960s rock musician Syd Barrett, composer and vocalist in the original line up of the band Pink Floyd. Featuring contemporary interviews with band members and some original footage from the swinging 1960s, this documentary portrays the downfall of a life full of potential - ruined by psychodelic drugs and mental health problems. Syd’s departure from the band in 1968 and his personal problems are not the only things that still resonate with band members and friends - his musical contribution and influence also live on. Contains interviews with friends and fans and features some classic early Pink Floyd songs. Narrated by Kirsty Wark. Other band members featured are David Gilmour, Roger Waters, Nick Mason and Rick Wright.

results.title: The Pill = Pilula = La Pilule = Die Tablette
results.brief_description: When a pill is dropped in a glass of water, it produces froth which overflows the glass, invades the room, the apartment, the street, the city and ends up covering the whole world.

results.title: The Pilgrims
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and John Barnes
results.brief_description: A recreation of the events leading to the settlement of the first English colony in New England. Shows the hardships of the first winter on Cape Cod, the problems of government as solved by the Mayflower Compact, the relationship between the settlers and the native Americans, and the celebration of the first Thanksgiving.
